overall_summary: The reasoning demonstrates a methodical approach to forecasting 96 hourly data points using simple averaging to capture daily seasonality. The analyst thoroughly examines the data for patterns and trends, acknowledges limitations of the short dataset (only 4 days), and prioritizes practicality by selecting an interpretable method. The solution focuses on generating complete output with consistent formatting.
common_data_patterns: Possible increasing trend (observed but not projected)
No missing values in historical data
key_insights: Hourly averaging effectively captures daily seasonality for short-term forecasts
Limited historical data (4 days) restricts trend projection reliability
Explicit handling of data completeness requirements for output generation
Value rounding consistency (3 decimals) matching input data format
complexity_analysis: Moderately complex with detailed data examination and step-by-step computation, but uses fundamentally simple statistical methods due to data limitations.
